fields.headline: Escape's pick of the week
fields.bodyText: The Bush Camp A new bush camp on the coastal floodplains of the Mary River delta, west of Kakadu National Park in the Northern Territories is now welcoming guests who want to spot birds and wildlife from a luxury base. There are just three ensuite rooms built on raised platforms with views across the floodplains, with six more due to be finished by February. The lodge has a bar, library, lounge and swimming pool, and activities on offer include air-boat trips, fishing, crocodile-spotting river cruises and 4WD safaris. A three-night stay with Bridge & Wickers (020 7483 6555; www.bridgeandwickers.co.uk) costs from £1,240 per person including three days' 4WD hire, all meals, drinks and some activities. The Self-Drive Package Australia is crying out to be explored by car, particularly the more remote areas. Best At Australia Holidays (020 7849 4183; www.bestataustraliaholidays.co.uk) has a selection of self-drive packages, including car hire and hotels, such as a six-day journey from Perth, to the strange Pinnacles rock formations, the crayfishing centre Cervantes and Monkey Mia beach in Shark Bay, where you can pet the dolphins that swim right up to the shore. It costs £275 per person. The Group Tour Discover the hidden, inland region of Oz between Sydney and Cairns on The Great Divide group tour with Trek Australia (020 8772 3770; www.letstrekaustralia.com). You'll explore rainforests, Warrumbungle National Park, sand islands and outback towns - including Dubbo - visit an opal mine, hot springs and stay on a cattle station. Strewth. The 13 nights are spent camping, and it costs £674 per person excluding flights. Departures April-October next year. The Festival The Sydney Festival (0061 2 9250 7111; www.sydneyfestival.org.au) is set to attract a million or more people to theatre venues around the city, to watch 100 dance, music and drama events involving 780 artists from 6-27 January. The Family Adventure Kids will love the two-night camping safari at Katherine Gorge, Alice Springs with its reptile centre and Aboriginal bush walks, and a five-day self-drive to see Uluru, which are included in the two-week Red Centre Family Explorer package available from Austravel (0870 166 2070; www.austravel.com), for £4,949 for a family of four, including flights from London to Darwin, Darwin to Alice Springs and back to London.
